name: TheAtlantic
text: After Reddit published a letter in support of Black Lives Matter, its own users called the company out for hypocrisy. Now, they’re asking for real change on a site that has been famous for racism for years, @kait_tiffany reports. https://t.co/kcgwNKQLf3

name: TheAtlantic
text: The TV show “Cops” was a simulacrum of American police work, polished and cut and spliced into a hollow replica. @sophieGG on the long-running reality series that got canceled this week: https://t.co/vdcgRrhjIO

name: TheAtlantic
text: The truth buried beneath the surface: Your weekly guide to the best in books, by @mylmarche: https://t.co/GfieJEAvQn

name: TheAtlantic
text: “I wished I had a cigarette—I wish I smoked cigarettes. This was what they had been designed for, looking cool while waiting for things.” Read a new short story by Andrew Martin: https://t.co/XHzx3IKYXJ

name: TheAtlantic
text: Evidence of a looming coronavirus pandemic was building for years, but scientists who study the virus had struggled to get funding to convince Americans of the risk, Charles Schmidt writes. https://t.co/HlkWFoW9Wq

name: TheAtlantic
text: The big tech companies are eager to help the government respond to the pandemic. What’s in it for them? @FranklinFoer asks. https://t.co/ZIHAqrwvcE

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Punk provides a kind of perfect buffet of opportunities to imagine yourself different than you really are—more engaged, more angry, more heartbroken." Andrew Martin talks with Thomas Gebremedhin about the role of music in teenage life: https://t.co/sycFU4AofZ

name: TheAtlantic
text: Hollywood has made many Vietnam War stories over the past 50 years, but very few have dug into the experiences of black servicemen in that conflict. Spike Lee's "Da 5 Bloods"—out on Netflix—is a masterful film that changes that, @davidlsims writes: https://t.co/Pw67oLMCWi

name: TheAtlantic
text: Bill de Blasio's turn from campaigning against racist police tactics to defending the NYPD’s crackdown on protests has disillusioned the city that twice elected him, @russellberman reports: https://t.co/RYCcxIQXzK

name: TheAtlantic
text: "If the first brick signals the beginning of a moral holiday for looters, the first thwack of a truncheon signals a moral holiday for cops primed to react to the unknown with fear and loathing," @gcaw writes: https://t.co/BG1NExZsOm

name: TheAtlantic
text: Americans seem antsy to restart their lives, but this pandemic isn’t over. In the meantime: Here’s what to watch, read, and listen to this weekend. The latest Atlantic Daily, from @mimbsy: https://t.co/uX7dZBquAN

name: TheAtlantic
text: Rhythmic gymnastics on a British seashore, anti-racism protests across the United States, the funeral procession of George Floyd in Houston, a wildfire in California, idled elephants in Thailand, and much more—via @TheAtlPhoto: https://t.co/9phn7n0Z4N

name: TheAtlantic
text: In our latest "Behind the Byline" feature, @edyong209 shares what it's like covering the coronavirus pandemic, how he got his journalism start, and the books and shows he's enjoying. https://t.co/PTCH95gySA

name: TheAtlantic
text: One biscuit tells a billion stories. @aliaallana tracks India's lockdown through the country's favorite comfort food: https://t.co/LlFKiGWJWy

name: TheAtlantic
text: "By minimizing the trials of black women and girls, the country will miss the full picture of devastation that the American police state imposes on African Americans," @whattamisaid writes: https://t.co/HfH3uhOCML

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The number of activists, partisans, and politicians who hop back and forth across the literal/serious divide—saying something with no expectation they will be taken at their word—will only grow this season," Andrew Ferguson writes: https://t.co/5QlGWUW5Fu

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: "Black girls are suspended from school at a rate six times higher than that of white girls. They are 'the fastest growing segment of the juvenile justice system....'" -- 
Strong piece from @whattamisaid:
https://t.co/zrC1yN81PM

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: Since everyone is talking about her, here is an interesting profile of @KamalaHarris from the primary season, from @lizweil:
https://t.co/PmKLk3AH7I

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: “'No, I don’t support defunding the police,' [Biden] told CBS News, thereby saving his candidacy. Maybe he had to say it: A poll this week showed that just 16 percent of Americans support cuts to police funding." -- 
Andrew Ferguson on police defunders: 
https://t.co/586VRUMzwE

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @whattamisaid: My latest in @TheAtlantic: "By minimizing the trials of black women and girls, the country will miss the full picture of devastation that the American police state imposes on African Americans."  https://t.co/DbrpNaGnmP

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @YAppelbaum: "As Virginia turns blue, the question is whether the GOP can stay close enough to the center to hold competitive seats—or whether it will become more extreme as it shrinks.” Some good reporting here from @emmaogreen https://t.co/sSoAZmn87d

name: TheAtlantic
text: “This is not what a food bank was designed to do.” The pandemic is creating a crisis of food insecurity, writes @Kapoor_ML. https://t.co/h62onanLjT
